item.description:
Join Buffett and me for a strenuous hike (by MSSF standards, anyway) with plenty of cardio and scenery to boot.  We'll leave from the Rocky Pond parking lot and combine the first Sunday hikes from 6/10 and 12/10 to hike to three ponds and up and down many hills.

This a flexible hike that can be lengthened if the group wants a slightly longer hike, but retains the possibility of some hikers opting for only half the distance.  The route covers a few dirt roads, plenty of forest trails, and a stretch on paved road.  The group will decide at the beginning on the exact type of hike desired but as always, the time a hike takes is not possible to predict precisely.  The pace is determined by the slowest hiker and stops for photos or snacks are always an option.  Estimated time is two and a half hours.

Bring water and snacks for two- and four-legged hikers.  I like to use trekking poles for a full body working (and help on those hills) and hiking boots to keep out the sand and forest debris.  Dress for the weather with appropriate layers and rain cancels.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Buffett's Body Building hike for the November First Sunday Hike
